column5: SINGAPORE  May 12 ExxonMobil has begun ramping up production at a new Indonesian oilfield  targeting peak output later this year of more than 200 000 barrels per day (bpd) that will add to an already oversupplied crude market.

UPDATE 1-Sprint offers to reimburse up to $50 mln for unauthorized charges
column5: NEW YORK  May 12 Sprint Corp has agreed to provide as much as $50 million of consumer relief to resolve a U.S. government lawsuit accusing the mobile carrier of letting third parties tack unauthorized charges on to customers' bills  a practice known as cramming.

column4: Sprint settles 'cramming' lawsuit  offers up to $50 mln relief
column5: NEW YORK  May 12 Sprint Corp has agreed to provide as much as $50 million of consumer relief to resolve a U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau lawsuit accusing the phone company of letting third parties tack unauthorized charges on to customers' phone bills.

column5: * Corporate earning guidance below analyst forecasts     * Focus on volatility in global bond markets     * Toyota shares lucklustre after earnings last week     * Bridgestone falls on soft quarterly result      By Hideyuki Sano     TOKYO  May 12 Japanese share prices slipped on Tuesday  losing momentum as investors considered the implications of conservative earnings guidance from Japanese companies and volatile bond markets.     The Nikkei share average fell 0.6 percent to 19 499.1
